ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: In this course, I learned about different methods of research. I also learned a lot about different ways to move, different ways to dance, and how movement corresponds with social contracts in society. I received my first exposure to movement philosophy, and I was able to draw connections between movement and politics/society.
I learned different techniques for generating, viewing, interpreting, and researching movement, as well as an approach to the world that posits movement as an integral component.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed the breadth of this course, we really went all over the place. The visiting guests were an excellent way of introducing a variety of viewpoints while maintaining a level of expertise. I felt that the different classes felt a little isolated, and would have liked to see them connect with each other more - this was particularly true of weeks with guest artists. I always find studio practice alongside traditional academic work highly effective, so I'd list that as a strength. I think the size of the class was also a strength, because we not only received individual attention from Emily but also became familiar with each other's work as well. I learned a ton from my peers in this course, which I really really value.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I greatly enjoyed this class. We were able to do quite a bit of research and then apply what we had found through movement and through writing.

Yes, you should always take a class with Emily if you have the option. This was a great course for movers across the spectrum, not just with dance backgrounds, and the kind of artistic and theoretical expansion that comes from a think tank like this is really enriched by having so many different perspectives.
